title: MAC Strobe Cream – Peachlite Review

organizations.name: mac ruby woo lipstick  mac pro longwear foundation  mac retro matte lipstick

text:
Skin type: Dry skin. 
Hi everyone,
Recently, mac has launched their spotlight collection in India, in which they had launched 4 new shades of their cult favourite strobe cream. If you are not familiar with the strobe cream by MAC , strobe cream is a multi-purpose product which can be used as a moisturiser for face or under the foundation as a primer or just on the high points of the face as a highlighter. There are 5 shades in their collection now
1. Silverlite.
2. Goldlite.
3. Peachlite.
4. Redlite.
5. Pink light (original)

Price: 2700 INR 
Product Description: 
The ultimate quick fix for skin now in shades of pink (original), peach, silver, red and gold. Super-powered with potent botanicals, it boosts the look of dull, flat or tired-looking skin with nutritious vitamins and a mega-dose of green tea . Brightens and clarifies with iridescent particles and antioxidants. Adds the softest glow to skin in sunlight to spotlight.

My Experience with MAC Strobe Cream – Peachlite: 
Packaging: The strobe cream comes housed in a white squeezy tube with a matte black twist up cap. The name of the brand and product is printed on the front and the shade name and details are printed on the back. 

Texture: I absolutely love this stuff. They can be used as a moisturiser to brighten up the complexion and to boost dull looking skin. These can be used underneath the foundation as a primer and on high points of the face as a very natural highlighter. The shade peachlite has a peachy pink sheen to it and will look very pretty on fair to medium skin tones. 

The texture of the strobe cream is like a lotion and feels non-sticky on the skin. Peachlite has a very fine peachy pink shimmers which do not sit into the pores and just adds a beautiful glow to the dull complexion. The original strobe cream had a thicker consistency than these but, these are lightweight and thinner in consistency than the regular strobe cream. 

I absolutely love the fact that this cream is a multi-purpose product. The cream spreads like butter on the skin and feels very lightweight on; these add an instant glow to the face without making you look like a disco ball. These can definitely be worn alone and as a daily highlighter when you just want a little bit of brightness. These do not clog pores or cause acne. When I apply the strobe cream before makeup, I feel that my foundation goes on smoother and sits better even without a primer. This does increase the wear time of the foundation by 2 to 3 hours but, not more. 

Pros of MAC Strobe Cream – Peachlite: More shades to choose from. Multi-purpose product. Can be used alone or under foundation. Feels lightweight. Creates a beautiful base for makeup. Increases the wear time of the foundation . Adds an instant glow. Doesn’t clog pores or cause acne. Gives a very natural glow. Cons of MAC Strobe Cream – Peachlite: None. IMBB Rating: 5/5
Will you Recommend/Repurchase MAC Strobe Cream – Peachlite? 
Yes!
